emerge.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to appear or come out from somewhere
emerge.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The flowers emerge in the spring.
The sun emerged from behind the clouds.
emerge.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if facts emerge, they become known after being hidden or secret
emerge.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Later it emerged that the judge had employed an illegal immigrant.
emerge.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to come out of a difficult experience
emerge.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: She emerged from the divorce a stronger person.
emerge.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to begin to be known or noticed
emerge.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: a religious sect that emerged in the 1830s
Local government has recently emerged as a major issue.
